definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2

sentences.english: Daqi and Wang are also considering appeals.
sentences.chinese: 大旗网和王菲也在考虑上诉。

sentences.english: Fine linen with embroidered work from Egypt was that which thou spreadest forth to be thy sail;
sentences.chinese: 你的篷帆是用埃及绣花细麻布作的，可以作你的大旗。

sentences.english: The flag will be present at today's game against Appleton East High School.
sentences.chinese: 这面大旗出现在了该校与阿普尔顿东部高中的比赛中。

sentences.english: Zhang Chengzhi always spreads moral idealism in his novels.
sentences.chinese: 张承志始终高扬着道德理想主义的大旗。

sentences.english: He always carried the flag at the G. A. R. funerals in the town.
sentences.chinese: 城里举行军礼葬，他总是扛大旗。

sentences.english: To publicizes the "Contract Justice" banner, form contract must be regulated.
sentences.chinese: 为了张扬“契约正义”大旗，格式合同必须得到规制。

sentences.english: When the whirlwinds my banner unfurl.
sentences.chinese: 当旋风把我的大旗张扬。

definition: military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
to wave flags and shout battle cries (idiom); to egg sb on/to give support to
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
Red flag city district/Hongqi district of Xinxiang city 新鄉市|新乡市[Xin1 xiang1 shi4], Henan
(cry of encouragement)/to arise/to stand up/to gain the ascendancy/Come on!
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
